item.title: Clinical Development using RWD
item.description: How to RWD support Clinical Development RWD refers to data collected outside of conventional randomized controlled trials, usually from health records, insurance claims, disease registries and patient-reported outcomes. Here’s how it can be used to support clinical development in the pharma industry: Preclinical Development: RWD can help identify potential indications for new drugs based on real-world patient conditions and treatment outcomes. Clinical Trial Design: RWD can inform patient selection criteria, identify feasible study endpoints, predict trial length and recruitment rates, and design more meaningful comparative effectiveness studies.
